00036  * lustre/utils/gss/lgss_keyring.c
00037  *
00038  * user-space upcall to create GSS context, using keyring interface to kernel
00039  *
00040  * Author: Eric Mei <ericm@clusterfs.com>
00041  */

00043 #include <unistd.h>
00044 #include <stdlib.h>
00045 #include <stdio.h>
00046 #include <fcntl.h>
00047 #include <inttypes.h>
00048 #include <string.h>
00049 #include <errno.h>
00050 #include <pwd.h>
00051 #include <keyutils.h>
00052 #include <gssapi/gssapi.h>
00053 
00054 #include <libcfs/util/param.h>
00055 #include <libcfs/util/string.h>
00056 #include "lsupport.h"
00057 #include "lgss_utils.h"

00060 
00061 /*
00062  * gss target string of lustre service we are negotiating for
00063  */
00064 static char *g_service = NULL;
00065 
00066 /*
00067  * all data about negotiation
00068  */
00069 struct lgss_nego_data {
00070         uint32_t        lnd_established:1;
00071 
00072         int             lnd_secid;
00073         uint32_t        lnd_uid;
00074         uint32_t        lnd_lsvc;
00075         char           *lnd_uuid;
00076 
00077         gss_OID         lnd_mech;               /* mech OID */
00078         gss_name_t      lnd_svc_name;           /* service name */
00079         unsigned int    lnd_req_flags;          /* request flags */
00080         gss_cred_id_t   lnd_cred;               /* credential */
00081         gss_ctx_id_t    lnd_ctx;                /* session context */
00082         gss_buffer_desc lnd_rmt_ctx;            /* remote handle of context */
00083         uint32_t        lnd_seq_win;            /* sequence window */
00084 
00085         int             lnd_rpc_err;
00086         int             lnd_gss_err;
00087 };
00088 
00089 /*
00090  * context creation response
00091  */
00092 struct lgss_init_res {
00093         gss_buffer_desc gr_ctx;         /* context handle */
00094         unsigned int    gr_major;       /* major status */
00095         unsigned int    gr_minor;       /* minor status */
00096         unsigned int    gr_win;         /* sequence window */
00097         gss_buffer_desc gr_token;       /* token */
00098 };
00099 
00100 struct keyring_upcall_param {
00101         uint32_t        kup_ver;
00102         uint32_t        kup_secid;
00103         uint32_t        kup_uid;
00104         uint32_t        kup_fsuid;
00105         uint32_t        kup_gid;
00106         uint32_t        kup_fsgid;
00107         uint32_t        kup_svc;
00108         uint64_t        kup_nid;
00109         uint64_t        kup_selfnid;
00110         char            kup_tgt[64];
00111         char            kup_mech[16];
00112         unsigned int    kup_is_root:1,
00113                         kup_is_mdt:1,
00114                         kup_is_ost:1;
00115 };
00116 
00117 /****************************************
00118  * child process: gss negotiation       *
00119  ****************************************/
00120 
00121 int do_nego_rpc(struct lgss_nego_data *lnd,
00122                 gss_buffer_desc *gss_token,
00123                 struct lgss_init_res *gr)
00124 {
00125         struct lgssd_ioctl_param param;
00126         struct passwd *pw;
00127         int fd, ret, res;
00128         char outbuf[8192];
00129         unsigned int *p;
00130         glob_t path;
00131         int rc;
00132 
00133         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "start negotiation rpc\n");
00134 
00135         pw = getpwuid(lnd->lnd_uid);
00136         if (!pw) {
00137                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "no uid %u in local user database\n",
00138                        lnd->lnd_uid);
00139                 return -EACCES;
00140         }
00141 
00142         param.version = GSSD_INTERFACE_VERSION;
00143         param.secid = lnd->lnd_secid;
00144         param.uuid = lnd->lnd_uuid;
00145         param.lustre_svc = lnd->lnd_lsvc;
00146         param.uid = lnd->lnd_uid;
00147         param.gid = pw->pw_gid;
00148         param.send_token_size = gss_token->length;
00149         param.send_token = (char *) gss_token->value;
00150         param.reply_buf_size = sizeof(outbuf);
00151         param.reply_buf = outbuf;
00152 
00153         rc = cfs_get_param_paths(&path, "sptlrpc/gss/init_channel");
00154         if (rc != 0)
00155                 return rc;
00156 
00157         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "to open %s\n", path.gl_pathv[0]);
00158 
00159         fd = open(path.gl_pathv[0], O_WRONLY);
00160         if (fd < 0) {
00161                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't open %s\n", path.gl_pathv[0]);
00162                 rc = -EACCES;
00163                 goto out_params;
00164         }
00165 
00166         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "to down-write\n");
00167 
00168         ret = write(fd, &param, sizeof(param));
00169         close(fd);
00170         if (ret != sizeof(param)) {
00171                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "lustre ioctl err: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00172                 rc = -EACCES;
00173                 goto out_params;
00174         }
00175 
00176         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "do_nego_rpc: to parse reply\n");
00177         if (param.status) {
00178                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "status: %ld (%s)\n",
00179                        param.status, strerror((int)param.status));
00180 
00181                 /* kernel return -ETIMEDOUT means the rpc timedout, we should
00182                  * notify the caller to reinitiate the gss negotiation, by
00183                  * returning -ERESTART
00184                  */
00185                 if (param.status == -ETIMEDOUT)
00186                         rc = -ERESTART;
00187                 else
00188                         rc = param.status;
00189                 goto out_params;
00190         }
00191 
00192         p = (unsigned int *)outbuf;
00193         res = *p++;
00194         gr->gr_major = *p++;
00195         gr->gr_minor = *p++;
00196         gr->gr_win = *p++;
00197 
00198         gr->gr_ctx.length = *p++;
00199         gr->gr_ctx.value = malloc(gr->gr_ctx.length);
00200         memcpy(gr->gr_ctx.value, p, gr->gr_ctx.length);
00201         p += (((gr->gr_ctx.length + 3) & ~3) / 4);
00202 
00203         gr->gr_token.length = *p++;
00204         gr->gr_token.value = malloc(gr->gr_token.length);
00205         memcpy(gr->gr_token.value, p, gr->gr_token.length);
00206         p += (((gr->gr_token.length + 3) & ~3) / 4);
00207 
00208         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "do_nego_rpc: receive handle len %zu, token len %zu, "
00209                "res %d\n", gr->gr_ctx.length, gr->gr_token.length, res);
00210 out_params:
00211         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00212         return rc;
00213 }
00214 
00215 /*
00216  * if return error, the lnd_rpc_err or lnd_gss_err is set.
00217  */
00218 static int lgssc_negotiation(struct lgss_nego_data *lnd)
00219 {
00220         struct lgss_init_res    gr;
00221         gss_buffer_desc        *recv_tokenp, send_token;
00222         OM_uint32               maj_stat, min_stat, ret_flags;
00223 
00224         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "start gss negotiation\n");
00225 
00226         /* GSS context establishment loop. */
00227         memset(&gr, 0, sizeof(gr));
00228         recv_tokenp = GSS_C_NO_BUFFER;
00229 
00230         for (;;) {
00231                 maj_stat = gss_init_sec_context(&min_stat,
00232                                                 lnd->lnd_cred,
00233                                                 &lnd->lnd_ctx,
00234                                                 lnd->lnd_svc_name,
00235                                                 lnd->lnd_mech,
00236                                                 lnd->lnd_req_flags,
00237                                                 0,            /* time req */
00238                                                 NULL,         /* channel */
00239                                                 recv_tokenp,
00240                                                 NULL,         /* used mech */
00241                                                 &send_token,
00242                                                 &ret_flags,
00243                                                 NULL);        /* time rec */
00244 
00245                 if (recv_tokenp != GSS_C_NO_BUFFER) {
00246                         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &gr.gr_token);
00247                         recv_tokenp = GSS_C_NO_BUFFER;
00248                 }
00249 
00250                 if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE &&
00251                     maj_stat != GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED) {
00252                         lnd->lnd_gss_err = maj_stat;
00253 
00254                         logmsg_gss(LL_ERR, lnd->lnd_mech, maj_stat, min_stat,
00255                                    "failed init context");
00256                         break;
00257                 }
00258 
00259                 if (send_token.length != 0) {
00260                         memset(&gr, 0, sizeof(gr));
00261 
00262                         lnd->lnd_rpc_err = do_nego_rpc(lnd, &send_token, &gr);
00263                         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &send_token);
00264 
00265                         if (lnd->lnd_rpc_err) {
00266                                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "negotiation rpc error: %d\n",
00267                                        lnd->lnd_rpc_err);
00268                                 return -1;
00269                         }
00270 
00271                         if (gr.gr_major != GSS_S_COMPLETE &&
00272                             gr.gr_major != GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED) {
00273                                 lnd->lnd_gss_err = gr.gr_major;
00274 
00275                                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "negotiation gss error %x\n",
00276                                        lnd->lnd_gss_err);
00277                                 return -1;
00278                         }
00279 
00280                         if (gr.gr_ctx.length != 0) {
00281                                 if (lnd->lnd_rmt_ctx.value)
00282                                         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat,
00283                                                            &lnd->lnd_rmt_ctx);
00284                                 lnd->lnd_rmt_ctx = gr.gr_ctx;
00285                         }
00286 
00287                         if (gr.gr_token.length != 0) {
00288                                 if (maj_stat != GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED)
00289                                         break;
00290                                 recv_tokenp = &gr.gr_token;
00291                         }
00292                 }
00293 
00294                 /* GSS_S_COMPLETE => check gss header verifier,
00295                  * usually checked in gss_validate
00296                  */
00297                 if (maj_stat == GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00298                         lnd->lnd_established = 1;
00299                         lnd->lnd_seq_win = gr.gr_win;
00300                         break;
00301                 }
00302         }
00303 
00304         /* End context negotiation loop. */
00305         if (!lnd->lnd_established) {
00306                 if (gr.gr_token.length != 0)
00307                         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &gr.gr_token);
00308 
00309                 if (lnd->lnd_gss_err == GSS_S_COMPLETE)
00310                         lnd->lnd_rpc_err = -EACCES;
00311 
00312                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "context negotiation failed\n");
00313                 return -1;
00314         }
00315 
00316         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "successfully negotiated a context\n");
00317         return 0;
00318 }
00319 
00320 /*
00321  * if return error, the lnd_rpc_err or lnd_gss_err is set.
00322  */
00323 static int lgssc_init_nego_data(struct lgss_nego_data *lnd,
00324                                 struct keyring_upcall_param *kup,
00325                                 lgss_mech_t mech)
00326 {
00327         gss_buffer_desc         sname;
00328         OM_uint32               maj_stat, min_stat;
00329 
00330         memset(lnd, 0, sizeof(*lnd));
00331 
00332         lnd->lnd_secid = kup->kup_secid;
00333         lnd->lnd_uid = kup->kup_uid;
00334         lnd->lnd_lsvc = kup->kup_svc;
00335         lnd->lnd_uuid = kup->kup_tgt;
00336 
00337         lnd->lnd_established = 0;
00338         lnd->lnd_svc_name = GSS_C_NO_NAME;
00339         lnd->lnd_cred = GSS_C_NO_CREDENTIAL;
00340         lnd->lnd_ctx = GSS_C_NO_CONTEXT;
00341         lnd->lnd_rmt_ctx = (gss_buffer_desc) GSS_C_EMPTY_BUFFER;
00342         lnd->lnd_seq_win = 0;
00343 
00344         switch (mech) {
00345         case LGSS_MECH_KRB5:
00346                 lnd->lnd_mech = (gss_OID) &krb5oid;
00347                 lnd->lnd_req_flags = GSS_C_MUTUAL_FLAG;
00348                 break;
00349         default:
00350                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "invalid mech: %d\n", mech);
00351                 lnd->lnd_rpc_err = -EACCES;
00352                 return -1;
00353         }
00354 
00355         sname.value = g_service;
00356         sname.length = strlen(g_service);
00357 
00358         maj_stat = gss_import_name(&min_stat, &sname,
00359                                    (gss_OID) GSS_C_NT_HOSTBASED_SERVICE,
00360                                    &lnd->lnd_svc_name);
00361         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00362                 logmsg_gss(LL_ERR, lnd->lnd_mech, maj_stat, min_stat,
00363                            "can't import svc name");
00364                 lnd->lnd_gss_err = maj_stat;
00365                 return -1;
00366         }
00367 
00368         return 0;
00369 }
00370 
00371 void lgssc_fini_nego_data(struct lgss_nego_data *lnd)
00372 {
00373         OM_uint32       maj_stat, min_stat;
00374 
00375         if (lnd->lnd_svc_name != GSS_C_NO_NAME) {
00376                 maj_stat = gss_release_name(&min_stat, &lnd->lnd_svc_name);
00377                 if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE)
00378                         logmsg_gss(LL_ERR, lnd->lnd_mech, maj_stat, min_stat,
00379                                    "can't release service name");
00380         }
00381 
00382         if (lnd->lnd_cred != GSS_C_NO_CREDENTIAL) {
00383                 maj_stat = gss_release_cred(&min_stat, &lnd->lnd_cred);
00384                 if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE)
00385                         logmsg_gss(LL_ERR, lnd->lnd_mech, maj_stat, min_stat,
00386                                    "can't release credential");
00387         }
00388 }
00389 
00390 static
00391 int error_kernel_key(key_serial_t keyid, int rpc_error, int gss_error)
00392 {
00393         int      seqwin = 0;
00394         char     buf[32];
00395         char    *p, *end;
00396 
00397         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "revoking kernel key %08x\n", keyid);
00398 
00399         p = buf;
00400         end = buf + sizeof(buf);
00401 
00402         WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, seqwin);
00403         WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, rpc_error);
00404         WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, gss_error);
00405 
00406 again:
00407         if (keyctl_update(keyid, buf, p - buf)) {
00408                 if (errno != EAGAIN) {
00409                         logmsg(LL_ERR, "revoke key %08x: %s\n",
00410                                keyid, strerror(errno));
00411                         return -1;
00412                 }
00413 
00414                 logmsg(LL_WARN, "key %08x: revoking too soon, try again\n",
00415                        keyid);
00416                 sleep(2);
00417                 goto again;
00418         }
00419 
00420         logmsg(LL_INFO, "key %08x: revoked\n", keyid);
00421         return 0;
00422 }
00423 
00424 static
00425 int update_kernel_key(key_serial_t keyid,
00426                       struct lgss_nego_data *lnd,
00427                       gss_buffer_desc *ctx_token)
00428 {
00429         char        *buf = NULL, *p = NULL, *end = NULL;
00430         unsigned int buf_size = 0;
00431         int          rc;
00432 
00433         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "updating kernel key %08x\n", keyid);
00434 
00435         buf_size = sizeof(lnd->lnd_seq_win) +
00436                    sizeof(lnd->lnd_rmt_ctx.length) + lnd->lnd_rmt_ctx.length +
00437                    sizeof(ctx_token->length) + ctx_token->length;
00438         buf = malloc(buf_size);
00439         if (buf == NULL) {
00440                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: can't alloc update buf: size %d\n",
00441                        keyid, buf_size);
00442                 return 1;
00443         }
00444 
00445         p = buf;
00446         end = buf + buf_size;
00447         rc = -1;
00448 
00449         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, lnd->lnd_seq_win))
00450                 goto out;
00451         if (write_buffer(&p, end, &lnd->lnd_rmt_ctx))
00452                 goto out;
00453         if (write_buffer(&p, end, ctx_token))
00454                 goto out;
00455 
00456 again:
00457         if (keyctl_update(keyid, buf, p - buf)) {
00458                 if (errno != EAGAIN) {
00459                         logmsg(LL_ERR, "update key %08x: %s\n",
00460                                keyid, strerror(errno));
00461                         goto out;
00462                 }
00463 
00464                 logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "key %08x: updating too soon, try again\n",
00465                        keyid);
00466                 sleep(2);
00467                 goto again;
00468         }
00469 
00470         rc = 0;
00471         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "key %08x: updated\n", keyid);
00472 out:
00473         free(buf);
00474         return rc;
00475 }
00476 
00477 /*
00478  * note we inherited assumed authority from parent process
00479  */
00480 static int lgssc_kr_negotiate(key_serial_t keyid, struct lgss_cred *cred,
00481                               struct keyring_upcall_param *kup)
00482 {
00483         struct lgss_nego_data   lnd;
00484         gss_buffer_desc         token = GSS_C_EMPTY_BUFFER;
00485         OM_uint32               min_stat;
00486         int                     rc = -1;
00487 
00488         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "child start on behalf of key %08x: "
00489                "cred %p, uid %u, svc %u, nid %"PRIx64", uids: %u:%u/%u:%u\n",
00490                keyid, cred, cred->lc_uid, cred->lc_tgt_svc, cred->lc_tgt_nid,
00491                kup->kup_uid, kup->kup_gid, kup->kup_fsuid, kup->kup_fsgid);
00492 
00493         if (lgss_get_service_str(&g_service, kup->kup_svc, kup->kup_nid)) {
00494                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: failed to construct service "
00495                        "string\n", keyid);
00496                 error_kernel_key(keyid, -EACCES, 0);
00497                 goto out_cred;
00498         }
00499 
00500         if (lgss_using_cred(cred)) {
00501                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: can't using cred\n", keyid);
00502                 error_kernel_key(keyid, -EACCES, 0);
00503                 goto out_cred;
00504         }
00505 
00506         if (lgssc_init_nego_data(&lnd, kup, cred->lc_mech->lmt_mech_n)) {
00507                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: failed to initialize "
00508                        "negotiation data\n", keyid);
00509                 error_kernel_key(keyid, lnd.lnd_rpc_err, lnd.lnd_gss_err);
00510                 goto out_cred;
00511         }
00512 
00513         rc = lgssc_negotiation(&lnd);
00514         if (rc) {
00515                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: failed to negotiation\n", keyid);
00516                 error_kernel_key(keyid, lnd.lnd_rpc_err, lnd.lnd_gss_err);
00517                 goto out;
00518         }
00519 
00520         rc = serialize_context_for_kernel(lnd.lnd_ctx, &token, lnd.lnd_mech);
00521         if (rc) {
00522                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: failed to export context\n", keyid);
00523                 error_kernel_key(keyid, rc, lnd.lnd_gss_err);
00524                 goto out;
00525         }
00526 
00527         rc = update_kernel_key(keyid,  &lnd, &token);
00528         if (rc)
00529                 goto out;
00530 
00531         rc = 0;
00532         logmsg(LL_INFO, "key %08x for user %u is updated OK!\n",
00533                keyid, kup->kup_uid);
00534 out:
00535         if (token.length != 0)
00536                 gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &token);
00537 
00538         lgssc_fini_nego_data(&lnd);
00539 
00540 out_cred:
00541         lgss_release_cred(cred);
00542         return rc;
00543 }
00544 
00545 /*
00546  * call out info format: s[:s]...
00547  *  [0]: secid          (uint)
00548  *  [1]: mech_name      (string)
00549  *  [2]: uid            (uint)
00550  *  [3]: gid            (uint)
00551  *  [4]: flags          (string) FMT: r-root; m-mdt; o-ost
00552  *  [5]: lustre_svc     (uint)
00553  *  [6]: target_nid     (uint64)
00554  *  [7]: target_uuid    (string)
00555  *  [8]: self_nid        (uint64)
00556  */
00557 static int parse_callout_info(const char *coinfo,
00558                               struct keyring_upcall_param *uparam)
00559 {
00560         const int       nargs = 9;
00561         char            buf[1024];
00562         char           *string = buf;
00563         int             length, i;
00564         char           *data[nargs];
00565         char           *pos;
00566 
00567         length = strlen(coinfo) + 1;
00568         if (length > 1024) {
00569                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "coinfo too long\n");
00570                 return -1;
00571         }
00572         memcpy(buf, coinfo, length);
00573 
00574         for (i = 0; i < nargs - 1; i++) {
00575                 pos = strchr(string, ':');
00576                 if (pos == NULL) {
00577                         logmsg(LL_ERR, "short of components\n");
00578                         return -1;
00579                 }
00580 
00581                 *pos = '\0';
00582                 data[i] = string;
00583                 string = pos + 1;
00584         }
00585         data[i] = string;
00586 
00587         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "components: %s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s\n",
00588                data[0], data[1], data[2], data[3], data[4], data[5],
00589                data[6], data[7], data[8]);
00590 
00591         uparam->kup_secid = strtol(data[0], NULL, 0);
00592         strlcpy(uparam->kup_mech, data[1], sizeof(uparam->kup_mech));
00593         uparam->kup_uid = strtol(data[2], NULL, 0);
00594         uparam->kup_gid = strtol(data[3], NULL, 0);
00595         if (strchr(data[4], 'r'))
00596                 uparam->kup_is_root = 1;
00597         if (strchr(data[4], 'm'))
00598                 uparam->kup_is_mdt = 1;
00599         if (strchr(data[4], 'o'))
00600                 uparam->kup_is_ost = 1;
00601         uparam->kup_svc = strtol(data[5], NULL, 0);
00602         uparam->kup_nid = strtoll(data[6], NULL, 0);
00603         strlcpy(uparam->kup_tgt, data[7], sizeof(uparam->kup_tgt));
00604         uparam->kup_selfnid = strtoll(data[8], NULL, 0);
00605 
00606         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "parse call out info: secid %d, mech %s, ugid %u:%u, "
00607                "is_root %d, is_mdt %d, is_ost %d, svc %d, nid 0x%"PRIx64", "
00608                "tgt %s, self nid 0x%"PRIx64"\n",
00609                uparam->kup_secid, uparam->kup_mech,
00610                uparam->kup_uid, uparam->kup_gid,
00611                uparam->kup_is_root, uparam->kup_is_mdt, uparam->kup_is_ost,
00612                uparam->kup_svc, uparam->kup_nid, uparam->kup_tgt,
00613                uparam->kup_selfnid);
00614         return 0;
00615 }
00616 
00617 static void set_log_level()
00618 {
00619         unsigned int level;
00620         glob_t path;
00621         FILE *file;
00622 
00623         if (cfs_get_param_paths(&path,
00624                                 "sptlrpc/gss/lgss_keyring/debug_level") != 0)
00625                 return;
00626         file = fopen(path.gl_pathv[0], "r");
00627         if (file == NULL) {
00628                 cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00629                 return;
00630         }
00631 
00632         if (fscanf(file, "%u", &level) != 1)
00633                 goto out;
00634 
00635         if (level >= LL_MAX)
00636                 goto out;
00637 
00638         lgss_set_loglevel(level);
00639 out:
00640         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00641         fclose(file);
00642 }
00643 
00644 /****************************************
00645  * main process                         *
00646  ****************************************/
00647 
00648 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00649 {
00650         struct keyring_upcall_param     uparam;
00651         key_serial_t                    keyid;
00652         key_serial_t                    sring;
00653         key_serial_t                    inst_keyring;
00654         pid_t                           child;
00655         struct lgss_mech_type          *mech;
00656         struct lgss_cred               *cred;
00657 
00658         set_log_level();
00659 
00660         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "start parsing parameters\n");
00661         /*
00662          * parse & sanity check upcall parameters
00663          * expected to be called with:
00664          * [1]:  operation
00665          * [2]:  key ID
00666          * [3]:  key type
00667          * [4]:  key description
00668          * [5]:  call out info
00669          * [6]:  UID
00670          * [7]:  GID
00671          * [8]:  thread keyring
00672          * [9]:  process keyring
00673          * [10]: session keyring
00674          */
00675         if (argc != 10 + 1) {
00676                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "invalid parameter number %d\n", argc);
00677                 return 1;
00678         }
00679 
00680         logmsg(LL_INFO, "key %s, desc %s, ugid %s:%s, sring %s, coinfo %s\n",
00681                argv[2], argv[4], argv[6], argv[7], argv[10], argv[5]);
00682 
00683         memset(&uparam, 0, sizeof(uparam));
00684 
00685         if (strcmp(argv[1], "create") != 0) {
00686                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "invalid OP %s\n", argv[1]);
00687                 return 1;
00688         }
00689 
00690         if (sscanf(argv[2], "%d", &keyid) != 1) {
00691                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't extract KeyID: %s\n", argv[2]);
00692                 return 1;
00693         }
00694 
00695         if (sscanf(argv[6], "%d", &uparam.kup_fsuid) != 1) {
00696                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't extract UID: %s\n", argv[6]);
00697                 return 1;
00698         }
00699 
00700         if (sscanf(argv[7], "%d", &uparam.kup_fsgid) != 1) {
00701                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't extract GID: %s\n", argv[7]);
00702                 return 1;
00703         }
00704 
00705         if (sscanf(argv[10], "%d", &sring) != 1) {
00706                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't extract session keyring: %s\n", argv[10]);
00707                 return 1;
00708         }
00709 
00710         if (parse_callout_info(argv[5], &uparam)) {
00711                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't extract callout info: %s\n", argv[5]);
00712                 return 1;
00713         }
00714 
00715         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "parsing parameters OK\n");
00716 
00717         /*
00718          * prepare a cred
00719          */
00720         mech = lgss_name2mech(uparam.kup_mech);
00721         if (mech == NULL) {
00722                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: unsupported mech: %s\n",
00723                        keyid, uparam.kup_mech);
00724                 return 1;
00725         }
00726 
00727         if (lgss_mech_initialize(mech)) {
00728                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: can't initialize mech %s\n",
00729                        keyid, mech->lmt_name);
00730                 return 1;
00731         }
00732 
00733         cred = lgss_create_cred(mech);
00734         if (cred == NULL) {
00735                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: can't create a new %s cred\n",
00736                        keyid, mech->lmt_name);
00737                 return 1;
00738         }
00739 
00740         cred->lc_uid = uparam.kup_uid;
00741         cred->lc_root_flags |= uparam.kup_is_root ? LGSS_ROOT_CRED_ROOT : 0;
00742         cred->lc_root_flags |= uparam.kup_is_mdt ? LGSS_ROOT_CRED_MDT : 0;
00743         cred->lc_root_flags |= uparam.kup_is_ost ? LGSS_ROOT_CRED_OST : 0;
00744         cred->lc_tgt_nid = uparam.kup_nid;
00745         cred->lc_tgt_svc = uparam.kup_svc;
00746         cred->lc_self_nid = uparam.kup_selfnid;
00747 
00748         if (lgss_prepare_cred(cred)) {
00749                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: failed to prepare credentials "
00750                        "for user %d\n", keyid, uparam.kup_uid);
00751                 return 1;
00752         }
00753 
00754         /* pre initialize the key. note the keyring linked to is actually of the
00755          * original requesting process, not _this_ upcall process. if it's for
00756          * root user, don't link to any keyrings because we want fully control
00757          * on it, and share it among all root sessions; otherswise link to
00758          * session keyring.
00759          */
00760         if (cred->lc_root_flags != 0)
00761                 inst_keyring = 0;
00762         else
00763                 inst_keyring = KEY_SPEC_SESSION_KEYRING;
00764 
00765         if (keyctl_instantiate(keyid, NULL, 0, inst_keyring)) {
00766                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "instantiate key %08x: %s\n",
00767                        keyid, strerror(errno));
00768                 return 1;
00769         }
00770 
00771         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "instantiated kernel key %08x\n", keyid);
00772 
00773         /*
00774          * fork a child to do the real gss negotiation
00775          */
00776         child = fork();
00777         if (child == -1) {
00778                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "key %08x: can't create child: %s\n",
00779                        keyid, strerror(errno));
00780                 return 1;
00781         } else if (child == 0) {
00782                 return lgssc_kr_negotiate(keyid, cred, &uparam);
00783         }
00784 
00785         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "forked child %d\n", child);
00786         return 0;
00787 }
